003_PostEA.synopsis:
One of a group of refugees who sold their souls to the archdevil Zariel in exchange for the strength to survive their journey to Baldur's Gate. They've agreed to capture and kill Karlach, one of the origin characters, and if they do their souls will be their own again.

This refugee is confident of her chances of survival, but unnerved by the pact they signed.

SpokeWithDeadCrime.synopsis: A group of paladins react angrily to the player casting a speak with dead spell on one of their dead companions. They are angry enough to attack the player if the spell is repeated a second time.

Dead_PostEA.synopsis: A speak with dead dialogue triggered when talking to the corpse of a refugee who was killed by gnolls. The dead man had signed a pact with an archdevil before his death.

001_PostEA.synopsis:
These paladins signed their pact with Zariel for riches and power and serve her with relish. They've agreed to capture and kill Karlach, one of the origin characters.

This cultist is the leader of the group. He's friendly, but badly injured after his fight with Karlach.

002_PostEA.synopsis: Wary and abrupt. Disguised as a noble paladin of Tyr, this young is actually in league with the archdevil Zariel. She's hiding out in a tollhouse with her companions.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Analyzing the sessions shows two clear chains. First, there is a refugee whose dialogue is represented as a living encounter in '003_PostEA'. Later, if that refugee is killed—by gnolls per the description—talking to his corpse triggers 'Dead_PostEA'. This implies an ordering: the refugee must be encountered alive as in '003_PostEA' before his death yields the 'Dead_PostEA' dialog. Moreover, since a given encounter cannot contain both the live and the dead dialogue for the same character, '003_PostEA' and 'Dead_PostEA' are mutually exclusive in a single playthrough. In another chain, the paladins encounter in '001_PostEA' involve a group that has active members. One of these paladins (or one of their companions) dies, and if the player later casts speak with dead on that corpse, the 'SpokeWithDeadCrime' session is triggered. Therefore, '001_PostEA' must occur before 'SpokeWithDeadCrime' since the dead companion (or his corpse) originates from the group encountered in '001_PostEA'. The session '002_PostEA' does not have an indicated ordering relationship with the others based on the provided information.

003_PostEA_26.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_26.text: Keep that beast away from us - you hear?

003_PostEA_28.speaker: Karlach
003_PostEA_28.text: Me the beast? Now that's fucking rich.

003_PostEA_14.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_14.text: Ye gods - come back for us, have you, devil? Anders! The beast has returned!
003_PostEA_14.context: NodeContext: First to Karlach, then calling up and over his left shoulder to Anders

003_PostEA_9.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_9.text: Need any supplies? We've fewer mouths to feed now.
003_PostEA_9.context: NodeContext: Friendly, with a hint of regret - that 'one less mouth to feed' is dead in the next room

003_PostEA_27.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_27.text: Two. Both stalwarts of Tyr, sworn to uphold justice.

003_PostEA_8.speaker: Player
003_PostEA_8.text: I'll take those supplies now - and everything else you own.

003_PostEA_31.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_31.text: Oh, you fool. We'll destroy you.

003_PostEA_15.speaker: Player
003_PostEA_15.text: I pray their souls have returned to Tyr's grace.

003_PostEA_25.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_25.text: I... yes. I hope so too. Thank you.
003_PostEA_25.context: NodeContext: voice catching - she's been told to have hope about the fate of a dead companion's soul and doesn't feel it

003_PostEA_24.speaker: Player
003_PostEA_24.text: Paladins of Tyr, are you? The ones hunting down a woman named Karlach?

003_PostEA_16.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_16.text: Hunting her down? Trying to survive her, more like. You can't listen to a devil like that. They'll pour poison in your ear and say it's honey.

003_PostEA_33.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_33.text: Kill the devil, if you can. Otherwise, leave well enough alone.

003_PostEA_19.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_19.text: The Lord of Justice sent us after a devil haunting this area. We squared off against her. We lost.
003_PostEA_19.context: NodeContext: mildly indignant - heavy emphasis on 'slaughtered', light emphasis on 'one'.

003_PostEA_12.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_12.text: Talk to Anders if you want the details. I don't have it in me to recount the horror.

003_PostEA_20.speaker: Player
003_PostEA_20.text: Let's see what you have to trade.

003_PostEA_32.speaker: Player
003_PostEA_32.text: Sure, I'll take your supplies - and everything else you own.

003_PostEA_2.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA_2.text: I'm still looking to shift some supplies. Don't have much to spare, but it's more than we can carry.

SpokeWithDeadCrime_0.speaker: GROUP_ZarielCultists
SpokeWithDeadCrime_0.text: Stop that, or there'll be trouble. The dead deserve their rest.
SpokeWithDeadCrime_0.context: NodeContext: a harsh warning delivered to a player trying to cast a necromancy spell on the character's dead companion

SpokeWithDeadCrime_2.speaker: GROUP_ZarielCultists
SpokeWithDeadCrime_2.context: NodeContext: shouting to alert companions in nearby rooms

SpokeWithDeadCrime_1.speaker: GROUP_ZarielCultists
SpokeWithDeadCrime_1.context: NodeContext: quieter than previous lines - a threat to the player right before attacking

Dead_PostEA_1.speaker: Narrator
Dead_PostEA_1.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
Dead_PostEA_1.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse that doesn't react to a speak with dead spell we've just cast

Dead_PostEA_7.speaker: Narrator
Dead_PostEA_7.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse that the player just cast a speak with dead spell on

Dead_PostEA_21.speaker: Refugee
Dead_PostEA_21.text: ... infernal... servant... so long I've forgotten... why...

Dead_PostEA_12.speaker: Player
Dead_PostEA_12.text: You killed a pack of gnolls. How?

Dead_PostEA_18.speaker: Player
Dead_PostEA_18.text: A pact? Which devil did you deal with?

Dead_PostEA_4.speaker: Refugee
Dead_PostEA_4.context: NodeContext: a speaking corpse - Zariel is an arch-devil

Dead_PostEA_23.speaker: Player
Dead_PostEA_23.text: Why would you sign a pact with a devil?

Dead_PostEA_22.speaker: Player
Dead_PostEA_22.text: Who was the tiefling you sought?

Dead_PostEA_10.speaker: Player
Dead_PostEA_10.text: What did you want with the tiefling?

Dead_PostEA_6.speaker: Narrator
Dead_PostEA_6.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*
Dead_PostEA_6.context: NodeContext: a speak with dead spell has just run its course

001_PostEA_21.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_21.text: I thank you for taking our side. You had no reason to trust us, yet your faith spared us a grisly end.

001_PostEA_15.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_15.text: Our lord Tyr sent us in pursuit of that devil. She had already butchered a family fleeing the armies of the Absolute by the time we caught up with her.

001_PostEA_145.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_145.text: She bested us once, and would have finished the job if not for you.

001_PostEA_7.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_7.text: Why did she think you agents of Zariel?

001_PostEA_6.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_6.text: I suppose she sought cover for her own crimes by accusing us.

001_PostEA_139.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_139.text: But she's dead now. She can't hurt anyone anymore. You are our protector - Tyr's blessings are upon you.

001_PostEA_57.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_57.text: It was my duty to protect you.

001_PostEA_114.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_114.text: Maybe I was too hasty. Maybe she was right about you.

001_PostEA_53.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_53.text: She wasn't. Let me prove it to you with a gift.

001_PostEA_19.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_19.text: She wasn't. I may not be able to convince you, but Tyr's blessing is now upon you. Let him strike me down if I take his word in vain.

001_PostEA_26.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_26.text: Our scouts told us you'd come. The devil's ally. Come to finish us, have you?

001_PostEA_30.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_30.text: You must mean Karlach. I know the truth about who you are.

001_PostEA_62.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_62.text: I'm sure she's invented a fascinating history of our crimes. The truth is far simpler.

001_PostEA_82.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_82.text: We are paladins of Tyr, Lord of Justice. He sent us after an infernal being, straight out of the Nine Hells, hiding in the form of a one-horned tiefling - Karlach.

001_PostEA_4.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_4.text: She's slaughtered countless refugees fleeing the Absolute. Yesterday, she butchered an entire family. We were lucky to survive our encounter with her.

001_PostEA_99.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_99.text: Say I buy your story. What then?

001_PostEA_88.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_88.text: Then you'd be very stupid indeed.
001_PostEA_88.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

001_PostEA_78.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_78.text: First I was burned within in inch of my life, and now I'm stuck playing pantomime. I can't take it anymore.
001_PostEA_78.context: NodeContext: the mask drops; he reveals his true nature. not a suffering paladin but an agent of evil

001_PostEA_120.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_120.text: Karlach is going back to Avernus, and if she won't go quietly, she dies. It looks like I'll have to kill you first, which I quite look forward to. Bye-bye.

001_PostEA_63.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_63.text: If you serve the Lord of Justice, prove it. Recite the Creed of the Left Hand.

001_PostEA_91.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_91.text: That depends on you. Are you what she says you are?

001_PostEA_109.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_109.text: That's right. I'm sending you back to Avernus where you belong.

001_PostEA_134.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_134.text: Tsk. Poor Karlach. Allied with the first sap she met, who will be so quickly destroyed.
001_PostEA_134.context: NodeContext: The jig is up and Anders' demeanor changes. He drops the veil of the lie of the kindly paladin and reveals himself for what he is

001_PostEA_40.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_40.text: Zariel will find this all terribly funny.

001_PostEA_58.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_58.context: NodeContext: enthusiastically greeting a player he believes is a fellow cultist

001_PostEA_65.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_65.text: Your actions saved many souls - Tyr be with you.

001_PostEA_68.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_68.text: Wh-who's there? Please - keep your distance. You're welcome to shelter here, but we've grave injuries to tend to.

001_PostEA_116.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_116.text: A devil - the most deadly foe we've yet encountered.

001_PostEA_137.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_137.text: We are paladins of Tyr, Lord of Justice. He sent us after an infernal being, straight out of the Nine Hells, hiding in the form of a one-horned tiefling.

001_PostEA_107.speaker: Wyll
001_PostEA_107.text: One horn? Then you mean Karlach. Archdevil's bootlicker.

001_PostEA_96.speaker: Narrator
001_PostEA_96.text: *One horn. He means Karlach - there is no doubting it.*

001_PostEA_130.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_130.text: You know her. Which means you know what the fiend's capable of.

001_PostEA_39.speaker: Narrator
001_PostEA_39.text: *That's Karlach all right. If you believe her story, these so-called paladins are lying.*

001_PostEA_118.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_118.text: She's slaughtered countless refugees fleeing the Absolute. Yesterday, she butchered an entire family without mercy.

001_PostEA_113.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_113.text: We were lucky to survive our encounter with her.

001_PostEA_128.speaker: Narrator
001_PostEA_128.text: *This could be the work of a devil, but they collect souls through cunning, not carnage.*

001_PostEA_9.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_9.text: She ran toward the river when she saw we were merely wounded - not dead. Down the hill from here.

001_PostEA_135.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_135.text: She must pay for her crimes. If you capture her, you will have served Tyr where we could not.

001_PostEA_108.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_108.text: This is the Sword of Justice, blessed by Tyr. I've wielded it since I swore my oath.

001_PostEA_1.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_1.text: It's all I have, but it's yours if you stop her. Bring me her head, and Tyr will consider her crimes repaid.

001_PostEA_100.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_100.text: Very well. I'll bring you her head.

001_PostEA_123.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_123.text: May the Just God guide you.

001_PostEA_72.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_72.text: I have other things to deal with.

001_PostEA_60.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_60.text: The only head that will roll is yours.

001_PostEA_20.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_20.text: It isn't like a devil to use their brawn instead of their brains.

001_PostEA_155.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_155.text: Indeed. She's a uniquely vicious case. All the more reason she must be stopped.

001_PostEA_11.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_11.text: Truly? I believe I've met her.

001_PostEA_106.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_106.text: Then you're lucky to be alive.
001_PostEA_106.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

001_PostEA_14.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_14.text: I've already dealt with her. She's dead.

001_PostEA_70.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_70.text: If that's true, this is the first glimmer of hope we've had for a long while. But I'll need proof.
001_PostEA_70.context: NodeContext: He's just been told the fiend he hunts is dead. Surprise and hope.

001_PostEA_48.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_48.text: Bring me her head, and I'll give you my blade. It carries Tyr's blessing - and you will have earned it by carrying out his justice.
001_PostEA_48.context: NodeContext: Making a reasonable bargain. 'Tyr' (TEER) is his god

001_PostEA_44.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_44.text: Let me help. I can hunt down this monster.

001_PostEA_141.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_141.text: I wish you and yours well, but I must be on my way soon.

001_PostEA_77.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_77.text: I understand. But if you see the fiend, be on your guard. She's dangerous.

001_PostEA_61.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_61.text: I've met her. She said you were servants of Zariel sent to take her back to Avernus.

001_PostEA_12.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_12.text: A devilish lie. She nearly killed me with her hellacious flames, and now she's sent you to finish the job.

001_PostEA_67.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_67.text: I've been called a devil before. Are you sure this tiefling is what you say?

001_PostEA_56.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_56.text: The fiend may have been a tiefling once, but she belongs to Avernus now. I wish it were not so, and I bear no grudge against your people.

001_PostEA_18.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_18.text: Truth and justice, brother. My oath is in Tyr's name. I am sorry to hear about the fate of your mission.

001_PostEA_93.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_93.text: A fellow paladin? What fortune. You might be able to succeed where we failed.

001_PostEA_122.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_122.text: Now that she softened you up, I'll finish you off.

001_PostEA_84.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_84.text: Fool. All you'll get is a broken skull.

001_PostEA_138.speaker: Narrator
001_PostEA_138.text: *You recognise the description - the burning tiefling you met by the river.*

001_PostEA_98.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_98.text: I heard a tiefling called Karlach nearly roasted you to death.

001_PostEA_55.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_55.text: Believe me, she's no tiefling, but a devil. We were lucky to escape.

001_PostEA_54.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_54.text: Just yesterday, the devil Karlach slaughtered countless refugees. An entire family met their end at her hands - including a pregnant mother.

001_PostEA_97.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_97.text: A tollhouse, once upon a time. Now a house of respite for those of us burned by a devil.

001_PostEA_111.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_111.text: Cut the act. I know what you are. Agents of Zariel here to collect an asset.

001_PostEA_102.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_102.text: Agents of... let me guess. The devil Karlach herself told you that profane lie.

001_PostEA_17.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_17.text: We are paladins of Tyr, sworn to protect those in need. He sent us to hunt Karlach down, but she was too vicious for us.

001_PostEA_129.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_129.text: Look at me. The devil nearly burned me to the bone. A tiefling couldn't do that without powerful magics. She's something far worse.

001_PostEA_148.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_148.text: Say I buy your story. What then?

001_PostEA_86.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_86.text: I disagree. I think you're something far worse.

001_PostEA_47.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_47.text: Believe what you will, but do it in silence. We have wounded to tend to - and a return home to plan.

001_PostEA_80.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_80.text: It isn't too late to do the right thing, though.

001_PostEA_142.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_142.text: Before you go - I wouldn't be a proper paladin if I didn't try to enlist your help in a righteous battle.

001_PostEA_90.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_90.text: If you serve the Lord of Justice, prove it. Recite the Creed of the Left Hand.

001_PostEA_131.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_131.text: To arms, comrades. We are discovered.

001_PostEA_75.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_75.text: Rest easy. I'll only stay a short time.

001_PostEA_51.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_51.text: Tyr protect you. Be on your watch. There's a devil in the guise of a one-horned tiefling haunting the Risen Road.

001_PostEA_83.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_83.text: She's dead. Finally we can rest.

001_PostEA_105.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_105.text: You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.

001_PostEA_74.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_74.text: But here is my blade, blessed by Tyr. I hope it keeps you safe, and brings your enemies to justice.

001_PostEA_73.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_73.text: We owe you every gratitude. If we had something - anything - to give, we would. But our thanks - and Tyr's gratitude - will have to suffice for now.

001_PostEA_136.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_136.text: Bless you in all your doings - in Justice's name.

001_PostEA_85.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_85.text: Perhaps you've decided to chase down the fiend after all?

001_PostEA_124.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_124.text: Any sign of the tiefling fiend?
001_PostEA_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Attach sword of justice to waistNodeContext: enthusiastically greeting a player he believes is a fellow cultist

001_PostEA_150.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_150.text: She's dead, but I couldn't retrieve her head.

001_PostEA_8.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_8.text: Here's her head. Just like you asked.

001_PostEA_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Martin K - Player takes out Karlach's decapitaded head, tosses on ground

001_PostEA_36.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_36.text: You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.

001_PostEA_71.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_71.text: But here is my blade, blessed by Tyr. I hope it keeps you safe, and brings your enemies to justice.
001_PostEA_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes out his sword, and presents it to player, player takes sword.NodeContext: shows his sword

001_PostEA_50.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_50.text: Thank you. As promised, here is my blade, blessed by Tyr.

001_PostEA_143.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_143.text: It's sacred... the most valuable thing I've ever held. I hope it serves you as well as it served me.
001_PostEA_143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes out his sword, and presents it to player, player takes sword.NodeContext: with reverence - he's passing us a holy weapon, with awe and regret to be losing it

001_PostEA_126.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_126.text: A grim business - but justice has been served. May Tyr watch over you.

001_PostEA_110.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_110.text: Remind me - how will I recognise her?

001_PostEA_95.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_95.text: She only has one horn, and she looks like she could rip your arms off with her bare hands. Hard to miss.
001_PostEA_95.context: NodeContext: impatient, describing a fearsome adversary

001_PostEA_5.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_5.text: I met her. She says you're the fiends, and I believe her.

001_PostEA_76.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_76.text: I met her by the river, not far from here.

001_PostEA_0.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA_0.text: But she's still alive? We need her head.
001_PostEA_0.context: NodeContext: Delighted on first word - then enthusiastic and determined

001_PostEA_119.speaker: Player
001_PostEA_119.text: Drop the act - you're no paladin. You serve the archdevil Zariel.

002_PostEA_0.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_0.text: I can only  thank you for choosing us over the devil. Tyr's blessings upon you.

002_PostEA_17.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_17.text: If you want to go poking around in the cellar, be my guest. Plug your nose first though.
002_PostEA_17.context: NodeContext: Turning her attention from a trapdoor to the player. With a smirk on the last sentence

002_PostEA_13.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_13.text: Corpse, half-rotted to mush. Must have been down there a tenday or more.
002_PostEA_13.context: NodeContext: with a shudder on the first sentence - of disgust rather than horror. 'tenday' is an in-universe term similar to 'week'.

002_PostEA_18.speaker: Player
002_PostEA_18.text: This is a nice place to hole up in. What is it?

002_PostEA_5.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_5.text: It was a tollhouse. By the time we arrived, it was more like a slaughterhouse.
002_PostEA_5.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - explaining a reality of the world

002_PostEA_4.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_4.text: There's more monsters than coin moving down this road.

002_PostEA_7.speaker: Player
002_PostEA_7.text: Tollhouses mean gold. Seen any around?

002_PostEA_14.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_14.text: There's a locked door down the hatch. Doesn't look like anyone managed to get in.

002_PostEA_6.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_6.text: If there's any gold left, that's where it'll be.

002_PostEA_2.speaker: Player
002_PostEA_2.text: Are you one of the paladins of Tyr I heard about? I met a woman - Karlach - who said you were after her.

002_PostEA_3.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_3.text: She nearly killed us all, and she says we're after her? Can't stop a devil from lying, can you.

002_PostEA_19.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_19.text: Unless you took her head already, I suggest you stay far away from her.

002_PostEA_1.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA_1.text: You can relax - this place is under Tyr's protection.
